questions.text: What will be the result of compiling and running the following class?
Which statement is true about destructors in Java?

answers.text: They are declared in the following way: MyClass::~MyClass();.
You must override the method destroy from Object to use them.
They must be annotated with @Destructor before they are called, so the garbage collector knows to remove it earlier than expected.
They are indirectly interpreted as a method called finalize, called at the discretion of the garbage collector.
